dialogue.String: Kukhu...Hahmkyanmho khoronhma-sahlmi, chakgon buhim!1�
Kweh?Kharabom, tspoluhi...!Ahk! What business have you here!?1�
(Though merely exchanging words with a heretic heathen can be punished with an eternity of damnation, the almighty Tzee Xicu will surely forgive me for what I am about to do...)1�
Ahem...kwahk!I am Loo Kohor, servant of Tzee Xicu the Manifest. I have traveled from mighty Castle Oztroja in the mountains of Aragoneu to deliver a message to the Orcs.1�
However, it seems that information of my visit has not been relayed to the lower ranks of the Orcish army.1�
And as you probably already know, the oversized swine do not make a habit of asking many questions before they proceed in prodding you with one of their pointy weapons.1�
Alright.Adventurer, are you not?1�
I hear tales that your type will do just about anything...if the price is right.1�
What say you? Hear my offer?I'm all ears.What? What!?1�
Hmph...Will not lend your services to a ��lowly�� beastman, I see.Now, who truly is the ��beast��?1�
Kwah!So the rumors are true. In the shadow of gold, your faith is lost. What pitiful creatures you are...1�
However, I am not one to judge those who have chosen to walk their path in darkness.I need you to deliver this parchment to the Orcish Overlord. You will be paid upon your return.1�
What say you?I'm your �[man/woman]!Deliver it yourself!1�

Second thoughts?While your faith hides behind the temptation of carnal pleasures, those temptations are no match for the cowardice that rots your pitiful soul. Go on, now. Leave this place before you stumble and scratch your knee.1�
Kwahah! Excellent....Hm? Not thinking of walking into Orc lair looking like that, are we?1�
The pathetic barbarians would slice you into ribbons and serve your flesh to the Overlord for supper. A disguise is what you need.1�
Why not skin one of the grunts and use its thick leather to make yourself a mask to hide that repulsive face?1�
I shall be waiting for you here when you have made your preparations.1�
I was wondering when you would return. Now let me see your...1�
Orlmhattjmha!Y-you don't really think you will fool the Orcs with that...that...thing, do you?1�
<Sigh>...However, I guess I have not any choice but to trust you and your plan. Here is the communication you are to deliver.1�
You are to take it and place it within the Overlord's cryptexphere.1�
Again, I will be waiting here for you behind these boulders, but let my will guide your spirit safely through this nest of fiends.1�
So that's what magicite looks like.1�
What could they possibly want with it?1�
What the...?1�
You are too late.I have awoken.1�
The Shadow Lord? It can't be! His powers have returned!1�
Then it is true! The beastmen are trying to resurrect the Shadow Lord.1�
You are too late.I have awoken.1�
Your rage, cowardice, envy, arrogance, and apathy... From these I will spread the bane of Vana'diel.1�
Your kind has awoken me...and this time, you will be destroyed!1�
You cannot stop me. Vana'diel will be a grave for you and all your kind!1�
The king has taken a beautiful queen, and I think a splendid addition to the royal family is not far off. An heir, perhaps...1�
You called for me, Your Majesty?1�
Oh, yes, that. Those Bastoker Humes are causing no end of trouble--saying they want to investigate here, there, and the other place...1�
As you command, my lord. I would give the very blood that runs in my veins if it were to further the cause of our kingdom. You can rely on me.1�
I understand, Your Grace.1�
Yes, sire! My life for the Kingdom!1�
Francmage?I was not expecting you so soon. Monarlais...tell him.1�
Very good. Do well, Francmage.1�
Yes, sire.�
Francmage, I've summoned you here today to talk about one thing--the Northlands investigation.1�
We must take control of this situation immediately. Still, we cannot let them walk about the Northlands freely. Who knows what they're plotting under the guise of this ��investigation.��1�
Francmage, listen. Go with the investigation party, and keep a close eye on what our foreign ��friends�� do. They are up to something, it is certain.1�
I am sure nothing will come of this, but in case they do find something in that wasteland, do not let them take it. Understood?1�
It is true! The Humes are fools, and no better. Can they truly believe that some ancient power lies hidden in that forsaken wasteland?1�
Hah! Do they hope to find the gates to eternal Paradise there, in that lair of fiends most uncouth? Preposterous!1�
These foreigners are wily and faithless. Never let down your guard, and may the Goddess of the Dawn protect you in Her mercy.1�
The king has taken a beautiful queen, and I think a splendid addition to the royal family is not far off. An heir, perhaps...1�
We people of San d'Oria, too, must ever look to the future. The Elvaan must never fall behind foreigners, in power or faith.1�
Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.1�
Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?1�
I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.1�
Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.1�

What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.The Circle of Time.An Understanding Overlord?(pt.1).An Understanding Overlord?(pt.2).An Understanding Overlord?(pt.3).An Understanding Overlord?(pt.4).An Understanding Overlord?(pt.5).An Understanding Overlord?(pt.6).Magicite(pt.1).Magicite(pt.2).1�
Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.1�
